Dispute_Type: Dispute over acceptable identification documents for permanent residence application
Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Officer breached procedural fairness or erred in rejecting the applicant's identification
Review_Court: Federal Court (implied by judicial review context)
Outcome: Application granted, case remitted for reconsideration
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - requirement to provide passport or travel document
Basis_of_Claim: Unreasonable rejection of provided identification documents
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of adequate explanation for document rejection creating a Catch-22
Application_Error: Failure to accept alternative identity documents without justification
Review_Outcome: Remitted for reconsideration by a different officer
Application_Factor: Submission of non-standard but legitimate identity documents
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - documentation requirements and procedural fairness
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to provide acceptable passport or travel document (as determined by officer)
Evidentiary_Issues: Officials rejected submitted documents without adequate explanation
Procedural_Fairness: Breach found due to lack of meaningful opportunity to respond
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural fairness and reasonableness
Omission_Type: Failure to provide adequate explanation for rejection
